alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CROCKETT COUNTY THROUGH 615 AM CDT... At 529 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 8 miles west of The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, or 17 miles south of Ozona, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail, along with frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. In addition, heavy rainfall in a short period of time could cause localized flooding. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973. This includes Interstate 10 near Mile Marker 377. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
